title.narrative: 703.7 QUALITY & INCLUSIVE EDU (RKLA 4)

description.narrative: Output 703.7 Children's Right to quality education on the basis of equal opportunity (RKLA 4): The RO will facilitate a programmatic environment in the region that enables a reduction of equity gaps in access to basic education and a greater inclusion of all children in quality learning, particularly all children and adolescents out of school and at risk of dropping out (children with disabilities, ethnic minorities, girls, young children and adolescents from marginalized families)., which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 703. PROGRAMMES: UNICEF contributes to the achievement of the results established in the MTSP and other national and international commitments for children in CEE/CISâ€”in development and humanitarian contextsâ€”with active technical assistance and oversight support from the Regional Office.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 703.7 Children?s Right to quality education on the basis of equal opportunity (RKLA 4): The RO will facilitate aprogrammatic environment in the region that enables a reduction of equity gaps in access to basic education and a greater inclusionof all children in quality learning, particularly all children and adolescents out of school and at risk of dropping out (childrenwith disabilities, ethnic minorities, girls, young children and adolescents from marginalized families).
